subject: Investing
title: Payout Ratio: Is the Dividend Safe?
description: A micro-lesson that makes Payout Ratio: Is the Dividend Safe? usable.

hook.text: A company paying 95% of earnings as dividends left almost nothing for growthâ€”or for bad quarters.

buildup.text: The payout ratio is dividends paid divided by net income. It shows how much profit goes to shareholders.

discovery.text: A ratio under 60% generally means the company can maintain the dividend even if earnings dip temporarily.

twist.text: REITs often have 90%+ payout ratios by law. For them, use funds from operations (FFO) instead of earnings.

climax.text: Track the payout ratio over 5+ years. A steadily rising ratio with flat earnings signals future cuts.

punchline.text: A sustainable payout ratio is the difference between income and broken promises.

quiz.question: What does a payout ratio over 90% typically indicate?
options: The dividend may be at risk if earnings decline
